metadata.title: CVE-2017-7104 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in certain Apple products. iOS before 11 isaffected. Safari before 11 is affected. iCloud before 7.0 on Windows isaffected. iTunes before 12.7 on Windows is affected. tvOS before 11 isaffected. The issue involves the "WebKit" component. It allows remoteattackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memorycorruption and application crash) via a crafted web site.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7104` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.18.0-2
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.18.0-2
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.18.0-2
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.18.0-2
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.18.0-2
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.18.0-2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.18.0-2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.18.0-2
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.18.0-2
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.18.0-2
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.18.0-2
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.18.0-2
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.18.0-2
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.18.0-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.18.0-2').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
